slides.title: What is C#?

content.text: Developed by **Microsoft** as a part of its **.NET** initiative
Used for building a wide range of **applications**, including **web**, **mobile**, and **desktop** apps
Known for its **strongly typed** variables and **garbage collection**

slides.notes: Introduce the topic with a brief overview of C#.

slides.title: Key Features of C#

content.text: Use of **interfaces** and **abstract classes** for defining contracts and blueprints
Support for **generics** and **type parameters** for reusable code
Use of **LINQ** for querying and manipulating data

slides.code: public class Example { public static void Main() { Console.WriteLine("Hello, World!"); } }
slides.notes: Highlight the key features that make C# a popular choice.

slides.title: C# Syntax and Basics

content.text: Variables and **data types**, such as **int**, **string**, and **bool**
Control structures, such as **if-else** statements and **loops**

slides.code: int x = 5; string name = "John"; bool isAdmin = true;
slides.notes: Cover the basic syntax and elements of the C# language.

slides.title: Real-World Applications of C#

content.text: Developing **desktop applications**, such as **Windows Forms** and **WPF**
